recipe.intro: How to make "Brot Knoedel", a German bread dumpling. This recipe comes from my grandma who was born on the Bavarian side of Germany. Knoedel can be dozens of flavors, but this one is only bread. This recipe was passed down generations in the 19th and 20th centuries, so measurements are a little strange.
recipe.matTwo: -A medium sized spoon, roughly a tablespoon
recipe.instructOne: Start by taking a piece of bread and pull the piece apart into little bits. Fill a bowl with the entire loaf.
recipe.instructTwo: Fill the coffee mug with milk and put in the microwave for 1 minute and 30 seconds
recipe.instructThree: Crack two eggs into the bowl and add 4 scoops of flour with the spoon into the mixture.
recipe.instructFour: To mix the ingredients together, kneed the dough using your hands until the mixture is clumped together and slightly sticky.
recipe.instructFive: Roll the mixture in the palm of your hands into the shape of a tennis ball (Using water to dampen your fingertips helps the dough stick to the dumpling, not your hands).
recipe.cooking: Place the dumplings into boiling water for 20 minutes.
recipe.cookingNext: After 20 minutes, place the dumplings onto a plate and let them cool for about 5-8 minutes.
recipe.sauce: If you would like something to dip the dumplings into, gravy is one of the best options for a savory flavor.
